intro: Phyllanthus melleri, commonly known as the African spurge, is a flowering plant native to Africa and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its small, clustered flowers and milky sap. The plant typically grows as an herb or shrub, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its leaves are alternate and pinnately compound, with a distinctive, rough texture. Phyllanthus melleri is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
